articles.author: Allie Kelly, Jireh Deng
articles.title: What baby boomers learned from weathering the Great Recession — and what they regret - Business Insider
articles.description: Three Americans in or near retirement told BI how they navigated the 2008 Great Recession — and their top ways to cope with uncertainty.
articles.content:
Lynn Benning, 67, said every financial downturn has hit her differently.
During the stagflation of 1980, she was in her 20s, single, and stressed out about affording rent on an entry-level income.
… [+6097 chars]

articles.title: Why voting rights groups warn the SAVE Act may make it harder for married women to vote - PBS
articles.description: An estimated 69 million American women and 4 million men do not have a birth certificate that matches their current legal name.
articles.content:
This story was originally published by The 19th on April 10, 2025.
